#Text=Donate a Boat to Charity
#Text=Do you have a boat you no longer want , or no longer want to maintain ?

#Text=It ’s not easy to sell a luxury item like a boat in today ’s economy , but you can still alleviate your burden as a boat owner and enjoy some financial gain , if only in terms of a tax deduction , and help a charitable organization at the same time .
#Text=The steps outlined here apply to the United States .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Choose a Reputable Charity
#Text=Research before you donate .
#Text=There are a number of sites that offer charitable deductions for your boat , but check to see if they are legitimate before you give away your boat :
#Text=See if the organization has 501(c ) status with the IRS .
#Text=Look up the status of the organization on the nonprofit list of the Better Business Bureau .
#Text=Consult Charity Navigator .
#Text=Remember , due to the Separation of Church and State , churches and religious organizations are exempt from applying for nonprofit status .

#Text=Donations made to these organizations are still considered tax deductible , and as an added benefit , they are 50 % organizations which means that you will be allowed to deduct up to 50 % of your AGI .
#Text=If you cannot find a specific charity in the IRS database , consult the charity to determine whether they fall into this category .
#Text=Donate Your Boat
#Text=Go to the website of the charity you have selected .
#Text=Follow the website ’s instructions .
#Text=These websites generally have FAQ pages to explain how to donate your boat .
#Text=Most websites will provide answers to all your questions ; if not , contact the relevant person or webmaster to ask for more information .
#Text=Typical questions that are usually answered in the FAQs include :
#Text=How to determine if your boat donation is tax deductible
#Text=How to determine the value of your donated boat
#Text=How to arrange for your boat to be picked up ( or where you can drop it off if preferred )
#Text=The paperwork you will be required to provide
#Text=The timetable for picking up your boat .
#Text=Be sure to let the charity know whether related items are included .
#Text=For example , you may wish to include boating gear , life jackets , fishing paraphernalia , electronic equipment , etc.
#Text=Tips
#Text=Most charities accept all types of watercraft , from small motor boats to yachts .
#Text=Deducting the actual price the charity receives from the sale of your boat is a sure way to prevent overstating the value of your boat deduction on your tax return .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Most organizations must have the title to your boat .
#Text=However , if you do n’t have the title , you can usually make some alternative arrangements with the charity .
#Text=If your boat is worth more than $ 5,000 , then you will need an appraisal and a signed 8283 IRS tax form .
#Text=Most charities provide these services to you at no cost .
